[html] Banner for top of column

How to use the front/body/back matter in creating columns.
The choice is between all: use <front> for left-hand column, use <body> for centre column, and use <back> for right-hand columnbody: use <body> for right-hand column, generate left-hand with a TOC or whatever

The difference between TEI div levels and HTML. headings. TEI <div>s are implicitly or explicitly numbered from 0 upwards; this offset is added to that number to produce an HTML <Hn> element. So a value of 2 here means that a <div1> will generate an <h2>
Make a separate file for footnotes

row.cell: [html] Construction of navigation bar A file is looked for relative to the stylesheet (the second parameter of the document function), which is expected to contain a TEI <list> where each <item> has an embedded <xref>
XML resource defining a navigation bar. The XML should provide a <list> containing a series of <item> elements, each containing an <xref> link.

The complete URL when the document is being delivered from a web server (normally set by Apache or Cocoon)
Write to standard output channel
An ID passed to the stylesheet to indicate which section to display

cell.textarea: $ID"/>

row.cell: A wrapper around the ID, to allow for other ways of getting it
A path fragment to put before all internal URLs
The name of the output file
Directory in which to place generated files.
Encoding of output file(s).
Output method for output file(s).
Suffix of output file(s).
Public Doctype of output file(s).

cell.textarea: http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd

row.cell: System Doctype of output file(s).

The style of HTML (Simple, CSS or Table) which creates the layout for generated pages. The choice is between Simple: A linear presentation is createdCSS: The page is created as a series of nested <div>s which can be arranged using CSS into a multicolumn layoutTable: The page is created as an HTML table
Break back matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled).
Break front matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled).

Level at which to split sections. When processing a <div> or <div[0-5]>, compare the nesting depth and see whether to start a new HTML page. Since the TEI starts with <div1>, setting this parameter to 0 will cause top-level sections to be split apart. The default is not to split at all.

cell.textarea: tei:teiCorpus">.html   $STDOUT='true'"/>       $outputSuffix"/>

row.cell: Suffix for generated output files.
Display navigation panel at top of pages.
How to specify infra-document links. When a document is split, links need to be constructed between parts of the document. The default is to use a query parameter on the URL.
Construct links using existing ID values. It is often nice if, when making separate files, their names correspond to the ID attribute of the >div<. Alternatively, you can let the system choose names.
Whether to make split pages appear virtually as layers in HTML, or physically as separate pages or server requests.
Make an automatic table of contents
CSS class for second-level TOC entries

Depth at which to stop doing a recursive table of contents. You can have a mini table of contents at the start of each section. The default is only to construct a TOC at the top level; a value of -1 here means no subtoc at all.
Include the back matter in the table of contents.
Depth to which table of contents is constructed.
Include the front matter in the table of contents.
Which HTML element to wrap each TOCs entry in.
Which HTML element to wrap each TOC sections in.
Text to link back to from foot of ODD reference pages
URL to link back to from foot of ODD reference pages

cell.textarea: This page is copyrighted

CSS class for TOC entries
CSS class for links derived from <ptr>

CSS class for links derived from <xref>

cell.textarea: http://www.tei-c.org/release/xml/tei/stylesheet/tei.css

row.cell: CSS style file to be associated with output file(s)

cell.textarea: http://www.tei-c.org/release/xml/tei/stylesheet/tei-print.css

row.cell: CSS style file for print; this will be given a media=print attribute.
Secondary CSS style file; this will be given a media=screen attribute, so that it does not affect printing. It should be used for screen layout.
Default alignment of table cells
Default alignment of tables
Directory specification to put before names of graphics files, unless they start with "./"
Default file suffix for graphics files, if not directly specified
Scaling of imported graphics
Resolution of images. This is needed to calculate HTML width and height (in pixels) from supplied dimensions.
Display figures.
Display of <pb> element. Choices are "visible", "active" and "none".
How to display Relax NG schema fragments (rnc or rng)
Provide minimal context for a link
Character to insert at end of quote.
Character to insert at start of quote
HTML element to put around visible text of display URLs
[common] Hook where actions can be inserted when making a heading
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just after <body>
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just before the <body> ends. This can be used to add a page-wide footer block.
[html] Hook where Javascript calls can be inserted just after <body>
[html] Hook where extra CSS can be inserted
[html] Hook where code can be added to the HTML <head>. This would be used insert <meta> tags.
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when processing a figure
[html] Hook where extra Javascript functions can be defined
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just before the <address>
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted at the start of processing each section
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted at the beginning of the main text, after the header
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted after processing <TEI>
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted before processing <TEI>
[html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an <a> element
[html] Hooks where HTML can be inserted when processing <egXML> element
The home page for these stylesheets
Process elements according to assumptions of TEI P4
Title, author and date is taken from the <teiHeader> rather than looked for in the front matter
Generate a unique ID for all paragraphs
Character separating values in a rend attribute. Some projects use multiple values in rend attributes. These are handled, but the separator character must be specified.
Show a title and author at start of document
Be talkative while working.
